website_summaries.verdict: A thick anti-vibration padding on the palms plus impact protection on the back provide full hand coverage.
pros: HANDYLANDY's anti-vibration gloves feature a styrene-butadiene rubber (SBR) padding on not only the palm, but also each individual finger, offering maximum protection
There is an adjustable Velcro wrist strap which helps keep gloves secure while working
cons: As with most gloves, there is a marked decrease in dexterity while wearing this product

customer_reviews.title: Help with the pain.
customer_reviews.text: Got these for work when I'm stuck using heavy jackhammers at awkward angles or for long periods of time. Noticed a difference right away with the pain I was getting in my hands from the vibration. Good value for the price and they've held up so far in a smelter which is rare for most of the stuff I bring out there.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C

customer_reviews.title: Great work gloves
customer_reviews.text: Great work gloves. I wouldn't say they are the greatest for vibration resistance though. Tried riding my motorcycle with them and hands were numb after an hour of riding.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and very comfortable gloves for a good price. Padding in the palms and down the fingers with the rubber covering the whole back of the hand. I bought these for riding my dirt bike but might consider another pair as my firefighter extrication gloves once my current ones wear out. Only issue is that they aren’t touch screen but they didn’t advertise them as they were so no stars lost
customer_reviews.author: KyleJEverett

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves, but no help for vibration
customer_reviews.text: They look good, and are comfortable gloves for work or maybe for sports, but they did nothing for vibration. I bought these brand new, and went to work with a vibra-core device (a jackhammer bolted to a pipe) and I noticed absolutely no reduction with the gloves on than without. So, nice gloves, but no help for vibration.
customer_reviews.author: archygurl

customer_reviews.title: Really good gloves for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Really nice heavily padded gloves for less than the bigger name brand offerings. My only nitpicky comment is that the top side thermoplastic bits are on the thick side and will catch when working in tight spaces vs say the MPACT gloves. But if you're using these gloves where that's not an issue then I'd personally save a few bucks and buy these every time.
customer_reviews.author: BenC in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, couple of comments
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for mountain bike riding, was getting some discomfort on long rides gripping hard on technical sections. My hands measure at the beginning of large range and these fit good but no room to spare so if your hands are bigger go size up. Padding is good, almost too much for bike riding, but if I was jack hammering all day I'd appreciate it. I have not had long enough to judge wear but seem very well made good materials. Froggy.
customer_reviews.author: Ultimate V.

customer_reviews.title: To thick and stiff
customer_reviews.text: Gloves are too heavily padded on palm and top side making gloves to stiff. Very difficult to handle hand tools like wrenches and hammers. Best way to describe it is like trying to thread a needle with boxing gloves.
customer_reviews.author: HMS Beagle

customer_reviews.title: Best pair of gloves!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best gloves I have ever purchased. Gloves reduce vibration greatly but still have good dexterity like mechanics gloves. Padding is also on the top of the glove for extra protection. Highly recommended measuring your dominant hand to ensure proper fit. With padding on the palm and top, the fit is snug.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Savory

customer_reviews.title: Great for HEMA
customer_reviews.text: My husband has used these gloves twice for his HEMA practice. They are a little tight, and they make it harder to grip his sword because his hands cannot close as much as they can without the gloves. I think this issues would be present with any new pair of gloves. They have really protected his hands during practice, and he even threw some punches at metal railings and came away unscathed.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great fit!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these! He has very large hands, he’s 6 ft 3 and they fit him perfectly. He usually wears a 2X in latex gloves if that helps anyone. They do very well for outdoor work including chainsaw use. We have several trees were cutting down and these have been great so far.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeShopper

customer_reviews.title: Fall apart
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves if u don't use them for working. Do not get them damp, wet or they will get holes
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Relieved pain for a hurt man!
customer_reviews.text: I damaged some nerves in my arms after a car accident and thought that I would never use a power tool again. I discovered these and it gave me enough courage to give it a shot. They worked wonders! I had to stop a few times but all in all they did the job. They feel and fit great! I’m more than happy. My opinion is buy it!!
customer_reviews.author: Truuu!

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gloves!
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from vibratory urticaria (allergy to vibration) which is extremely uncomfortable. I would normally not be able to use a weed-whacker or ride a mountain bike on a trail, but these gloves work extremely well! I can weed-whack until my muscles give out instead of being covered in hives and miserable. I never thought I'd look forward to weed-whacking. I'm am so relieved (literally) to find these gloves. These are now one of my favorite things. To the designer/manufacturer of these gloves, thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and durable protection
customer_reviews.text: These are true to color and style and easy to put on and keep on. Only one teensy thing and that might be for just a bit more padding between the bends of the fingers. Overall a good shock absorber though. Glad these are available in big size.
customer_reviews.author: J W

customer_reviews.title: Good medium larp-style combat gloves
customer_reviews.text: I've used 2 pair of these gloves for a medieval combat larp-style sport, they have good finger and thumb impact protection so you won't be losing any nails, there isn't an appreciable gap between the knuckles and fingers so you're set there too. Regular shots with foam weapons are completely stopped and they're also fine to punch block reasonable force shots from bandshoppe and the like. I guess my only gripe is that they're a little tight in certain places for me but that's more of a hand shape thing than anything else, would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: greg bronson

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for close to a year now. They reduce hand numbness from weed eater and chainsaw use. I use different (cowhide) gloves for handling brush and moving wood and think this will make them long lasting.
customer_reviews.author: Bluecollarbob

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality but padding makes the dexterity suffer
customer_reviews.text: I returned these gloves because they did not meet my needs for dexterity. The fit and finish were very good for this price point. If you need allot of protection I think this would be good product to get.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Wong

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves have held up at work when no others would. Perhaps the only improvement I would consider it water resistance. Even the smallest amount of water soaks into the palms.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Even in xxl large it runs small USELESS
customer_reviews.text: Even in an extra extra-large glove this thing still runs small wouldn’t recommend it for the price pretty pricey for the cheap quality I’m returning it runs way too small USELESS
customer_reviews.author: MARCUS

customer_reviews.title: Thick gloves
customer_reviews.text: So, I bought these blind, when I needed some new work gloves for the yard and such. These were the wrong gloves for that. These are thick and heavy, likely designed for using while operating machines that typically vibrate the hands. Overall, these gloves are good quality but the wrong choice if you're looking for something that's basically utilitarian.
customer_reviews.author: Fontaine

customer_reviews.title: The best gloves ever, oilfield, construction, logistics these are the best.
customer_reviews.text: So I bought these before and the only complaint I had and other people too, was the really low quality velcro it had, in my previous review I stated that if the velcro was changed for a good quality one, I'd buy these for the rest of my life and here we are, got em again and the velcro is so much better, these ARE THE PERFECT GLOVES, NO DOUBT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Gonzalez Daisy Santos

customer_reviews.title: Not made well.
customer_reviews.text: I just use it for machinery mowers , trimmers and edgers. Nothing fancy and stitches are undone
customer_reviews.author: GERSON ALVAREZ

customer_reviews.title: Durable & comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses a jackhammer at work and his hands were hurting. We bought a different pair of gloves before (from a local hardware store) and they didn't help at all. He put these on and felt an instant difference. Very durable and comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: cary

customer_reviews.title: More to come Under Test. Test failed
customer_reviews.text: so far so good... I use my hands all day... looking for gloves that last. down hill after the second day by the 5th day no finger tips.
customer_reviews.author: Chance M.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: these really made a big difference when cutting wood and splitting with a maul. I was able to manipulate gas can lids without taking them off. I really would buy again and have no reservations recommending them. It will prevent aggravating carpal tunnel
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dope!
customer_reviews.text: I got these for an among us cosplay and they work great its a great shade of red and very sturdy. I feel like these things could take a real beating and still look really cool
customer_reviews.author: Eli perillo

customer_reviews.title: So glad we have these gloves!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves really help cut the nerve damage/discomfort from using power equipment. I borrowed them and found that they ease the pain from my arthritis when Mowing the lawn. We’re SO glad we bought these gloves!
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Not as flexible as most gloves
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pair of gloves when using my leaf blowers, helps protect my trigger finger from becoming aggravated and my entire hand, I highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: John L Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Too bulky and hot
customer_reviews.text: Too bulky and hot, gloves look nice but I likely won't be using them
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Really go so far.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these after overworking my hand in a home landscaping project. Durable so far (3 months old now, but the heaviest work is over) and very comfortable. A few points off for loss of dexterity, but no worse than thick leather gloves. I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: stephen guryan

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: Will buy more and at first are stiff but once u wear them in. WOW LOVE IT. Will buy more when i need some.
customer_reviews.author: Lukasz Kotarba

customer_reviews.title: Great for the gm.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and durable. Superb for pull day (pulldowns, deadlifts, rows and shrugging exercises).
customer_reviews.author: dlbilliard

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves
customer_reviews.text: They work exactly as they advertised. Very comfortable and padded. The durability is what surprised me because I usually run through gloves fast and they have held up for four months so far.
customer_reviews.author: Carson

customer_reviews.title: mislabeled ?
customer_reviews.text: My order says XXL but the package says XL. they are a bit snug
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Has real padding in the palm, and the backside is nice and rigid for impacts.
customer_reviews.text: Have carpal tunnel like problems, so I am utilizing these. Hopeful it'll help.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Good protective gloves
customer_reviews.text: Protects my husband hands from the pressure of the jackhammer and other tools.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Great fit !
customer_reviews.text: Very good fit. These gloves are a great fit. And they look sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Terry M.

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves
customer_reviews.text: Helps stop my hand from hurting from hours of weed whacking
customer_reviews.author: Shadownight730

customer_reviews.title: Cushiony
customer_reviews.text: Use them when using my high powered zero turn lawn mower. Gloves are very thick and padded. Put them on and get them wet the first time you use them to help break in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works excellent.
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves says it works great while using the brush cutter his hands didn't get numb from the vibration, cool, and my kids they just love it for its techie looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: Cherry A. London

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves
customer_reviews.text: 1st pair Busted @ seem 1st day working in them. Totally disappointed. Company reached out and made me whole. I received replacement gloves. This made my experience go from bad to awesome. And is saving my hands while I work.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Ware

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: I would love to give the is sco loves a fine star however they are comfortable and they have great knuckle protection but the patting on the Palm is just way too much for me it makes grabbing difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic smith

customer_reviews.title: Buy these
customer_reviews.text: The weed eater kills my hands and forearm, these absorb the vibration well. Very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves because I run a weed eater for several hours at a time. The vibration used to really bother me. With these gloves, the vibration is greatly reduced. The gloves fit well. I’m very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Fostersfarm

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product
customer_reviews.text: Not light but it adds protection for your fingers. Good purchase
customer_reviews.author: Promētheús

customer_reviews.title: supportive durable and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: these are the best work gloves I have ever had- I wear them when chaining splitting and stacking wood and they are very supportive and comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Mary Giordano

customer_reviews.title: Durable and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to use for longsword sparring with blunt steel. Works great, durable, absorbs and disperses the impact effectively. Decent padding on the palms. Fits and flexes well. The pinky is the only lapse in design; could benefit a slightly wider pad.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Allen

customer_reviews.title: For my dad
customer_reviews.text: My dad was hammering down some siding for the house, and hitting his thumb over and over, saw this, bought it immediately
customer_reviews.author: mongooseracer55

customer_reviews.title: Great as far as impact resistant
customer_reviews.text: Descent glove, but doesnt hold up on the under side by the wrist. Great as far as impact resistant! I'll definitely try another pair to see how they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: A. Robbins

customer_reviews.title: These gloves are durable!
customer_reviews.text: you can easily pick up things with the gloves on, non slip and fit well.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Wilson

customer_reviews.title: This glove is NOT a safety glove that is tested
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been working with HandLandy on their product and they create safety gloves they don’t even test for safety. If you need gloves that look good, that’s fine....but certified, they don’t do any testing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Investment
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of pipe work and these gloves work perfectly. I particularly love the hand and knuckle protection it provides. I will definitely order a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: Brother James

customer_reviews.title: Best gloves ever
customer_reviews.text: Best gloves I have ever purchased! Packaging was great and the gloves were very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: H R Frank

customer_reviews.title: Not durable!!!
customer_reviews.text: Their comfortable but not durable, after 2 hours of hard work, they got holds on them, sorry never buying this product any more.
customer_reviews.author: deyber jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Great item..one complaint
customer_reviews.text: Thick rubber makes these very stiff. It a huge problem but takes away from comfort and dexterity
customer_reviews.author: Amir

customer_reviews.title: Anti-vibratory!
customer_reviews.text: Keep my hands from swelling up when running the chains saw!
customer_reviews.author: D. Wixon

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I use them when I cut firewood with a chainsaw, they work great!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Description about item on website is not accurate
customer_reviews.text: I returned gloves because they are too bulky and my husband can't even make a fist with them on.
customer_reviews.author: Yarixa

customer_reviews.title: Just what hubby wanted
customer_reviews.text: Love the construction and fit of the glove. The color will be easy to spot as well
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great padding
customer_reviews.text: I work on home remodeling I can literally smack my hand with a hammer and I will barely feel it quality padding.
customer_reviews.author: David DeFerrante

customer_reviews.title: Needs stronger seems.
customer_reviews.text: The wrist band broke within the 3rd work week of daily use. Overall a good glove and very protective of your hands, seems like they only need a stronger inseem.
customer_reviews.author: Eon & Blunt

customer_reviews.title: Great for outdoors
customer_reviews.text: Great Gloves, should've got a Large but XL gives me alot of freeplay inside the gloves overall its all Guccii 👍🏾
customer_reviews.author: Edward M.

customer_reviews.title: Decent gloves
customer_reviews.text: Helped some. And Could do without all the padding on back of hand to be a little cooler in hot weather
customer_reviews.author: Tony jr

customer_reviews.title: High End
customer_reviews.text: Best useful gloves, I ever had... Strongly recommended to buy...
customer_reviews.author: Serkan AYKUT Dallas/TX

customer_reviews.title: Lost of padding but lack dexterity
customer_reviews.text: Very durable and thick but they're so thick you dont have very much dexterity while wearing them
customer_reviews.author: Guadalupe Silva

customer_reviews.title: Best gloves to buy on a budget
customer_reviews.text: Pro: The protection of the fingers and hands are the best quality. Con: Bulky but they do what they are made to do
customer_reviews.author: Douglas McMillan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love these gloves only problem is the fibers on the fingers come loose after a lot use.
customer_reviews.author: William W.

customer_reviews.title: Best gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are the only gloves I buy for work. They are very durable, best best!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Terence K.

customer_reviews.title: I wish the padding went all the way up the finger tips.
customer_reviews.text: Good grip but the thumb and index fingers wore out first.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis J. Prince Jr.

customer_reviews.title: thick gloves that seem durable so far
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good gloves I handgrind concrete at work and it helps with vibration but a little bulky
customer_reviews.author: Mark Lulgjurevic

customer_reviews.title: Great for Chainsaws.
customer_reviews.text: You lose a bit of dexterity with the extra padding, but as far as anti-vibration goes, they work well with chainsaws, and other power the tools.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Hands down one of the best gloves I ever bought. Well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Jaison Suprina

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are bulky and hot. You have to take them off to use a knife or tool and to put new line on a weed eater. I've used these now with a chain saw, weed eater, palm sander, angle grinder, impact chisel and a tree saw. My fingers and hands tingled just as much when after I wore them as when I don't. Just put them in the trash can.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: Works good that had to get a second pair. Work with pneumatic tools a lot of vibration works well.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

product_meta.title: Anti Vibration Gloves, SBR Padding, TPR Protector Impact Gloves, Men Mechanic Work Gloves (Large)
product_meta.description:
Size:Large| Color:RedHANDLANDY is a professional manufacturer with more than 10 year's experience in the gloves industry. We specialize in high-quality, durable work gloves for many professions including drivers, plumber, landscapers, masonry workers, electricians and construction workers and so on.
We develops and sells advanced-technology, task-specific safety gloves for applications that demand extreme reliability. Help each worker get the job done more safety, efficiently ans effectively. These Industries include drilling & production, manufacturing, construction & engineering, mining, utilities and public safety.

Key Benefits:

TPR Impact Protection: Thermo Plastic Rubber (TPR) knuckle guards and full-length fingertip protection reduce the risk of impact and pinching injuries.
Easy On. Easy Off : Heavy utility gloves with secure wrist closure provides a secure fit to your wrist that allows for easy glove removal between tasks.
Breathable Knitting Mesh: Anti vibration gloves with modern sporty spandex for breathable comfort and proper stretch for flexibility and performance.
This heavy impact Mechanic Work Gloves Fit for multi-uses: drilling, mowing the lawn, running the chains saw, power tools, and so on.

Specifications:

40% synthetic fibers, 30% spandex, 20%TPR, 10%neoprene
Gender: men women unisex
Size: Medium Large Extra large M/ L/ XL
M: 4.5"X 9.25"
L: 4.75"X 9.5"
XL: 5"X 9.75"
Color: Red Black
Type: Protective gloves against merchanical risks

Due to manual measurement, it's allows 1-3(cm) discrepancy
feature_bullets: Synthetic palm with 5mm SBR inner padded patch on each fingers and palm, help alleviate the vibration from the machines, perfect for mowing lawn, power tools, running chainsaw, great gifts to tire installer, box big handlers, loggers, metal workers, etc
Breathable knitting mesh back with 5mm Upgraded Thermo Plastic Rubber (TPR) protector, tough protection from impact to the back of hand with a softer and flexible fit
Secure Wrist Closure: Adjustable wrist strap provides a secure fit to your wrist that allows for easy glove removal between tasks.
Reinforced saddle: Extra protection between thumb and forefinger and padding to this typical wear point
High performance padded impact gloves for anti vibrant, certify to EN ISO 10819:2013

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars255 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
